titles.title: To require that the General Accounting Office study and report on possible connections between the recurring incidence of violence by postal employees and workplace-related frustrations experienced by postal workers generally.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: 6/27/2001--Introduced. Directs the General Accounting Office to study and report to Congress and the U.S. Postal Service on the extent to which the incidence of random yet recurrent violence on the part of current and former Postal Service employees might be related to levels of workplace-related problems and frustrations experienced by postal workers generally.
